segment_text: I had called upon my friend, Mr. Sherlock Holmes, one day in the autumn of last year and found him in deep conversation with a very stout, florid-faced, elderly gentleman with fiery red hair.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: With an apology for my intrusion, I was about to withdraw when Holmes pulled me abruptly into the room and closed the door behind me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You could not possibly have come at a better time, my dear Watson,” he said cordially.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I was afraid that you were engaged.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “So I am. Very much so.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Then I can wait in the next room.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Not at all. This gentleman, Mr. Wilson, has been my partner and helper in many of my most successful cases, and I have no doubt that he will be of the utmost use to me in yours also.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: The stout gentleman half rose from his chair and gave a bob of greeting, with a quick little questioning glance from his small fat-encircled eyes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Try the settee,” said Holmes, relapsing into his armchair and putting his fingertips together, as was his custom when in judicial moods.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I know, my dear Watson, that you share my love of all that is bizarre and outside the conventions and humdrum routine of everyday life.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: You have shown your relish for it by the enthusiasm which has prompted you to chronicle, and, if you will excuse my saying so, somewhat to embellish so many of my own little adventures.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Your cases have indeed been of the greatest interest to me,” I observed.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You will remember that I remarked the other day, just before we went into the very simple problem presented by Miss Mary Sutherland, that for strange effects and extraordinary combinations we must go to life itself, which is always far more daring than any effort of the imagination.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “A proposition which I took the liberty of doubting.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You did, Doctor, but none the less you must come round to my view, for otherwise I shall keep on piling fact upon fact on you until your reason breaks down under them and acknowledges me to be right.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Now, Mr. Jabez Wilson here has been good enough to call upon me this morning, and to begin a narrative which promises to be one of the most singular which I have listened to for some time.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: You have heard me remark that the strangest and most unique things are very often connected not with the larger but with the smaller crimes, and occasionally, indeed, where there is room for doubt whether any positive crime has been committed.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: As far as I have heard, it is impossible for me to say whether the present case is an instance of crime or not, but the course of events is certainly among the most singular that I have ever listened to.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Perhaps, Mr. Wilson, you would have the great kindness to recommence your narrative.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I ask you not merely because my friend Dr. Watson has not heard the opening part but also because the peculiar nature of the story makes me anxious to have every possible detail from your lips.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: As a rule, when I have heard some slight indication of the course of events, I am able to guide myself by the thousands of other similar cases which occur to my memory.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: In the present instance I am forced to admit that the facts are, to the best of my belief, unique.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: The portly client puffed out his chest with an appearance of some little pride and pulled a dirty and wrinkled newspaper from the inside pocket of his greatcoat.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: As he glanced down the advertisement column, with his head thrust forward and the paper flattened out upon his knee, I took a good look at the man and endeavoured, after the fashion of my companion, to read the indications which might be presented by his dress or appearance.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I did not gain very much, however, by my inspection.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Our visitor bore every mark of being an average commonplace British tradesman, obese, pompous, and slow.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He wore rather baggy grey shepherd’s check trousers, a not over-clean black frock-coat, unbuttoned in the front, and a drab waistcoat with a heavy brassy Albert chain, and a square pierced bit of metal dangling down as an ornament.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: A frayed top-hat and a faded brown overcoat with a wrinkled velvet collar lay upon a chair beside him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Altogether, look as I would, there was nothing remarkable about the man save his blazing red head, and the expression of extreme chagrin and discontent upon his features.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes’ quick eye took in my occupation, and he shook his head with a smile as he noticed my questioning glances.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Beyond the obvious facts that he has at some time done manual labour, that he takes snuff, that he is a Freemason, that he has been in China, and that he has done a considerable amount of writing lately, I can deduce nothing else.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Mr. Jabez Wilson started up in his chair, with his forefinger upon the paper, but his eyes upon my companion.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “How, in the name of good-fortune, did you know all that, Mr. Holmes?” he asked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “How did you know, for example, that I did manual labour. It’s as true as gospel, for I began as a ship’s carpenter.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Your hands, my dear sir. Your right hand is quite a size larger than your left.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: You have worked with it, and the muscles are more developed.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, the snuff, then, and the Freemasonry?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I won’t insult your intelligence by telling you how I read that, especially as, rather against the strict rules of your order, you use an arc-and-compass breastpin.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Ah, of course, I forgot that. But the writing?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What else can be indicated by that right cuff so very shiny for five inches, and the left one with the smooth patch near the elbow where you rest it upon the desk?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, but China?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The fish that you have tattooed immediately above your right wrist could only have been done in China. I have made a small study of tattoo marks and have even contributed to the literature of the subject.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: That trick of staining the fishes’ scales of a delicate pink is quite peculiar to China. When, in addition, I see a Chinese coin hanging from your watch-chain, the matter becomes even more simple.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Mr. Jabez Wilson laughed heavily. “Well, I never!” said he.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I thought at first that you had done something clever, but I see that there was nothing in it after all.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I begin to think, Watson,” said Holmes, “that I make a mistake in explaining.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: ‘_Omne ignotum pro magnifico_,’ you know, and my poor little reputation, such as it is, will suffer shipwreck if I am so candid. Can you not find the advertisement, Mr. Wilson?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, I have got it now,” he answered with his thick red finger planted halfway down the column. “Here it is.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: This is what began it all. You just read it for yourself, sir.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I took the paper from him and read as follows:
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “TO THE RED-HEADED LEAGUE: On account of the bequest of the late Ezekiah Hopkins, of Lebanon, Pennsylvania, U.S.A., there is now another vacancy open which entitles a member of the League to a salary of £ 4 a week for purely nominal services.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: All red-headed men who are sound in body and mind and above the age of twenty-one years, are eligible.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Apply in person on Monday, at eleven o’clock, to Duncan Ross, at the offices of the League, 7 Pope’s Court, Fleet Street.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What on earth does this mean?” I ejaculated after I had twice read over the extraordinary announcement.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Holmes chuckled and wriggled in his chair, as was his habit when in high spirits. “It is a little off the beaten track, isn’t it?” said he.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And now, Mr. Wilson, off you go at scratch and tell us all about yourself, your household, and the effect which this advertisement had upon your fortunes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: You will first make a note, Doctor, of the paper and the date.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is _The Morning Chronicle_ of April 27, 1890. Just two months ago.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Very good. Now, Mr. Wilson?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, it is just as I have been telling you, Mr. Sherlock Holmes,” said Jabez Wilson, mopping his forehead; “I have a small pawnbroker’s business at Coburg Square, near the City.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It’s not a very large affair, and of late years it has not done more than just give me a living.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I used to be able to keep two assistants, but now I only keep one; and I would have a job to pay him but that he is willing to come for half wages so as to learn the business.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What is the name of this obliging youth?” asked Sherlock Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “His name is Vincent Spaulding, and he’s not such a youth, either. It’s hard to say his age.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I should not wish a smarter assistant, Mr. Holmes; and I know very well that he could better himself and earn twice what I am able to give him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: But, after all, if he is satisfied, why should I put ideas in his head?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Why, indeed? You seem most fortunate in having an _employé_ who comes under the full market price.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is not a common experience among employers in this age. I don’t know that your assistant is not as remarkable as your advertisement.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, he has his faults, too,” said Mr. Wilson. “Never was such a fellow for photography.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Snapping away with a camera when he ought to be improving his mind, and then diving down into the cellar like a rabbit into its hole to develop his pictures.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: That is his main fault, but on the whole he’s a good worker. There’s no vice in him.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “He is still with you, I presume?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, sir. He and a girl of fourteen, who does a bit of simple cooking and keeps the place clean—that’s all I have in the house, for I am a widower and never had any family.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: We live very quietly, sir, the three of us; and we keep a roof over our heads and pay our debts, if we do nothing more.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The first thing that put us out was that advertisement. Spaulding, he came down into the office just this day eight weeks, with this very paper in his hand, and he says:
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘I wish to the Lord, Mr. Wilson, that I was a red-headed man.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Why that?’ I asks.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Why,’ says he, ‘here’s another vacancy on the League of the Red-headed Men.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It’s worth quite a little fortune to any man who gets it, and I understand that there are more vacancies than there are men, so that the trustees are at their wits’ end what to do with the money.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: If my hair would only change colour, here’s a nice little crib all ready for me to step into.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Why, what is it, then?’ I asked. You see, Mr. Holmes, I am a very stay-at-home man, and as my business came to me instead of my having to go to it, I was often weeks on end without putting my foot over the door-mat.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: In that way I didn’t know much of what was going on outside, and I was always glad of a bit of news.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Have you never heard of the League of the Red-headed Men?’ he asked with his eyes open.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Never.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Why, I wonder at that, for you are eligible yourself for one of the vacancies.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘And what are they worth?’ I asked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Oh, merely a couple of hundred a year, but the work is slight, and it need not interfere very much with one’s other occupations.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, you can easily think that that made me prick up my ears, for the business has not been over good for some years, and an extra couple of hundred would have been very handy.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Tell me all about it,’ said I.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Well,’ said he, showing me the advertisement, ‘you can see for yourself that the League has a vacancy, and there is the address where you should apply for particulars.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: As far as I can make out, the League was founded by an American millionaire, Ezekiah Hopkins, who was very peculiar in his ways.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was himself red-headed, and he had a great sympathy for all red-headed men; so, when he died, it was found that he had left his enormous fortune in the hands of trustees, with instructions to apply the interest to the providing of easy berths to men whose hair is of that colour.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: From all I hear it is splendid pay and very little to do.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘But,’ said I, ‘there would be millions of red-headed men who would apply.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Not so many as you might think,’ he answered. ‘You see it is really confined to Londoners, and to grown men.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: This American had started from London when he was young, and he wanted to do the old town a good turn.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then, again, I have heard it is no use your applying if your hair is light red, or dark red, or anything but real bright, blazing, fiery red.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Now, if you cared to apply, Mr. Wilson, you would just walk in; but perhaps it would hardly be worth your while to put yourself out of the way for the sake of a few hundred pounds.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Now, it is a fact, gentlemen, as you may see for yourselves, that my hair is of a very full and rich tint, so that it seemed to me that if there was to be any competition in the matter I stood as good a chance as any man that I had ever met.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Vincent Spaulding seemed to know so much about it that I thought he might prove useful, so I just ordered him to put up the shutters for the day and to come right away with me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was very willing to have a holiday, so we shut the business up and started off for the address that was given us in the advertisement.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I never hope to see such a sight as that again, Mr. Holmes. From north, south, east, and west every man who had a shade of red in his hair had tramped into the city to answer the advertisement.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: Fleet Street was choked with red-headed folk, and Pope’s Court looked like a coster’s orange barrow.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: I should not have thought there were so many in the whole country as were brought together by that single advertisement.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: Every shade of colour they were—straw, lemon, orange, brick, Irish-setter, liver, clay; but, as Spaulding said, there were not many who had the real vivid flame-coloured tint.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: When I saw how many were waiting, I would have given it up in despair; but Spaulding would not hear of it.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: How he did it I could not imagine, but he pushed and pulled and butted until he got me through the crowd, and right up to the steps which led to the office.
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: There was a double stream upon the stair, some going up in hope, and some coming back dejected; but we wedged in as well as we could and soon found ourselves in the office.”
scene_description: outdoors, victorian city street, cobblestone road, dense buildings, shopfronts

segment_text: “Your experience has been a most entertaining one,” remarked Holmes as his client paused and refreshed his memory with a huge pinch of snuff.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Pray continue your very interesting statement.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “There was nothing in the office but a couple of wooden chairs and a deal table, behind which sat a small man with a head that was even redder than mine.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: He said a few words to each candidate as he came up, and then he always managed to find some fault in them which would disqualify them.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: Getting a vacancy did not seem to be such a very easy matter, after all.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: However, when our turn came the little man was much more favourable to me than to any of the others, and he closed the door as we entered, so that he might have a private word with us.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘This is Mr. Jabez Wilson,’ said my assistant, ‘and he is willing to fill a vacancy in the League.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘And he is admirably suited for it,’ the other answered. ‘He has every requirement.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: I cannot recall when I have seen anything so fine.’ He took a step backward, cocked his head on one side, and gazed at my hair until I felt quite bashful.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: Then suddenly he plunged forward, wrung my hand, and congratulated me warmly on my success.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘It would be injustice to hesitate,’ said he. ‘You will, however, I am sure, excuse me for taking an obvious precaution.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: With that he seized my hair in both his hands, and tugged until I yelled with the pain. ‘There is water in your eyes,’ said he as he released me.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: ‘I perceive that all is as it should be. But we have to be careful, for we have twice been deceived by wigs and once by paint.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: I could tell you tales of cobbler’s wax which would disgust you with human nature.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: He stepped over to the window and shouted through it at the top of his voice that the vacancy was filled.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: A groan of disappointment came up from below, and the folk all trooped away in different directions until there was not a red-head to be seen except my own and that of the manager.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘My name,’ said he, ‘is Mr. Duncan Ross, and I am myself one of the pensioners upon the fund left by our noble benefactor.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: Are you a married man, Mr. Wilson? Have you a family?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “I answered that I had not.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “His face fell immediately.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Dear me!’ he said gravely, ‘that is very serious indeed! I am sorry to hear you say that.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: The fund was, of course, for the propagation and spread of the red-heads as well as for their maintenance. It is exceedingly unfortunate that you should be a bachelor.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “My face lengthened at this, Mr. Holmes, for I thought that I was not to have the vacancy after all; but after thinking it over for a few minutes he said that it would be all right.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘In the case of another,’ said he, ‘the objection might be fatal, but we must stretch a point in favour of a man with such a head of hair as yours.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: When shall you be able to enter upon your new duties?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Well, it is a little awkward, for I have a business already,’ said I.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Oh, never mind about that, Mr. Wilson!’ said Vincent Spaulding. ‘I should be able to look after that for you.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘What would be the hours?’ I asked.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Ten to two.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “Now a pawnbroker’s business is mostly done of an evening, Mr. Holmes, especially Thursday and Friday evening, which is just before pay-day; so it would suit me very well to earn a little in the mornings.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: Besides, I knew that my assistant was a good man, and that he would see to anything that turned up.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘That would suit me very well,’ said I. ‘And the pay?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Is £ 4 a week.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘And the work?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Is purely nominal.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘What do you call purely nominal?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Well, you have to be in the office, or at least in the building, the whole time. If you leave, you forfeit your whole position forever.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: The will is very clear upon that point. You don’t comply with the conditions if you budge from the office during that time.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘It’s only four hours a day, and I should not think of leaving,’ said I.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘No excuse will avail,’ said Mr. Duncan Ross; ‘neither sickness nor business nor anything else. There you must stay, or you lose your billet.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘And the work?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Is to copy out the _Encyclopædia Britannica_. There is the first volume of it in that press.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: You must find your own ink, pens, and blotting-paper, but we provide this table and chair. Will you be ready to-morrow?’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Certainly,’ I answered.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “‘Then, good-bye, Mr. Jabez Wilson, and let me congratulate you once more on the important position which you have been fortunate enough to gain.’
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: He bowed me out of the room and I went home with my assistant, hardly knowing what to say or do, I was so pleased at my own good fortune.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “Well, I thought over the matter all day, and by evening I was in low spirits again; for I had quite persuaded myself that the whole affair must be some great hoax or fraud, though what its object might be I could not imagine.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It seemed altogether past belief that anyone could make such a will, or that they would pay such a sum for doing anything so simple as copying out the _Encyclopædia Britannica_.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Vincent Spaulding did what he could to cheer me up, but by bedtime I had reasoned myself out of the whole thing.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: However, in the morning I determined to have a look at it anyhow, so I bought a penny bottle of ink, and with a quill-pen, and seven sheets of foolscap paper, I started off for Pope’s Court.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, to my surprise and delight, everything was as right as possible. The table was set out ready for me, and Mr. Duncan Ross was there to see that I got fairly to work.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: He started me off upon the letter A, and then he left me; but he would drop in from time to time to see that all was right with me.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: At two o’clock he bade me good-day, complimented me upon the amount that I had written, and locked the door of the office after me.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “This went on day after day, Mr. Holmes, and on Saturday the manager came in and planked down four golden sovereigns for my week’s work.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: It was the same next week, and the same the week after. Every morning I was there at ten, and every afternoon I left at two.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: By degrees Mr. Duncan Ross took to coming in only once of a morning, and then, after a time, he did not come in at all.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: Still, of course, I never dared to leave the room for an instant, for I was not sure when he might come, and the billet was such a good one, and suited me so well, that I would not risk the loss of it.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “Eight weeks passed away like this, and I had written about Abbots and Archery and Armour and Architecture and Attica, and hoped with diligence that I might get on to the B’s before very long.
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: It cost me something in foolscap, and I had pretty nearly filled a shelf with my writings. And then suddenly the whole business came to an end.”
scene_description: indoors, sparse office, wooden chairs, deal table, single window

segment_text: “To an end?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, sir. And no later than this morning.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I went to my work as usual at ten o’clock, but the door was shut and locked, with a little square of cardboard hammered on to the middle of the panel with a tack.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Here it is, and you can read for yourself.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He held up a piece of white cardboard about the size of a sheet of note-paper. It read in this fashion:
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “THE RED-HEADED LEAGUE IS DISSOLVED. October 9, 1890.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes and I surveyed this curt announcement and the rueful face behind it, until the comical side of the affair so completely overtopped every other consideration that we both burst out into a roar of laughter.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I cannot see that there is anything very funny,” cried our client, flushing up to the roots of his flaming head. “If you can do nothing better than laugh at me, I can go elsewhere.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No, no,” cried Holmes, shoving him back into the chair from which he had half risen. “I really wouldn’t miss your case for the world.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is most refreshingly unusual. But there is, if you will excuse my saying so, something just a little funny about it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Pray what steps did you take when you found the card upon the door?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I was staggered, sir. I did not know what to do.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then I called at the offices round, but none of them seemed to know anything about it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Finally, I went to the landlord, who is an accountant living on the ground floor, and I asked him if he could tell me what had become of the Red-headed League.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He said that he had never heard of any such body. Then I asked him who Mr. Duncan Ross was.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He answered that the name was new to him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Well,’ said I, ‘the gentleman at No. 4.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘What, the red-headed man?’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Yes.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Oh,’ said he, ‘his name was William Morris. He was a solicitor and was using my room as a temporary convenience until his new premises were ready.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He moved out yesterday.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Where could I find him?’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “‘Oh, at his new offices. He did tell me the address. Yes, 17 King Edward Street, near St. Paul’s.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I started off, Mr. Holmes, but when I got to that address it was a manufactory of artificial knee-caps, and no one in it had ever heard of either Mr. William Morris or Mr. Duncan Ross.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And what did you do then?” asked Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I went home to Saxe-Coburg Square, and I took the advice of my assistant. But he could not help me in any way.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He could only say that if I waited I should hear by post. But that was not quite good enough, Mr. Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I did not wish to lose such a place without a struggle, so, as I had heard that you were good enough to give advice to poor folk who were in need of it, I came right away to you.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And you did very wisely,” said Holmes. “Your case is an exceedingly remarkable one, and I shall be happy to look into it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: From what you have told me I think that it is possible that graver issues hang from it than might at first sight appear.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Grave enough!” said Mr. Jabez Wilson. “Why, I have lost four pound a week.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “As far as you are personally concerned,” remarked Holmes, “I do not see that you have any grievance against this extraordinary league.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: On the contrary, you are, as I understand, richer by some £ 30, to say nothing of the minute knowledge which you have gained on every subject which comes under the letter A. You have lost nothing by them.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No, sir. But I want to find out about them, and who they are, and what their object was in playing this prank—if it was a prank—upon me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was a pretty expensive joke for them, for it cost them two and thirty pounds.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “We shall endeavour to clear up these points for you. And, first, one or two questions, Mr. Wilson.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: This assistant of yours who first called your attention to the advertisement—how long had he been with you?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “About a month then.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “How did he come?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “In answer to an advertisement.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Was he the only applicant?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No, I had a dozen.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Why did you pick him?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Because he was handy and would come cheap.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “At half wages, in fact.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What is he like, this Vincent Spaulding?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Small, stout-built, very quick in his ways, no hair on his face, though he’s not short of thirty. Has a white splash of acid upon his forehead.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Holmes sat up in his chair in considerable excitement. “I thought as much,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Have you ever observed that his ears are pierced for earrings?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, sir. He told me that a gipsy had done it for him when he was a lad.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Hum!” said Holmes, sinking back in deep thought. “He is still with you?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, yes, sir; I have only just left him.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And has your business been attended to in your absence?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Nothing to complain of, sir. There’s never very much to do of a morning.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “That will do, Mr. Wilson. I shall be happy to give you an opinion upon the subject in the course of a day or two.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: To-day is Saturday, and I hope that by Monday we may come to a conclusion.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, Watson,” said Holmes when our visitor had left us, “what do you make of it all?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I make nothing of it,” I answered frankly. “It is a most mysterious business.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “As a rule,” said Holmes, “the more bizarre a thing is the less mysterious it proves to be.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is your commonplace, featureless crimes which are really puzzling, just as a commonplace face is the most difficult to identify. But I must be prompt over this matter.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What are you going to do, then?” I asked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “To smoke,” he answered. “It is quite a three pipe problem, and I beg that you won’t speak to me for fifty minutes.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He curled himself up in his chair, with his thin knees drawn up to his hawk-like nose, and there he sat with his eyes closed and his black clay pipe thrusting out like the bill of some strange bird.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I had come to the conclusion that he had dropped asleep, and indeed was nodding myself, when he suddenly sprang out of his chair with the gesture of a man who has made up his mind and put his pipe down upon the mantelpiece.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Sarasate plays at the St. James’s Hall this afternoon,” he remarked. “What do you think, Watson?
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Could your patients spare you for a few hours?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I have nothing to do to-day. My practice is never very absorbing.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Then put on your hat and come. I am going through the City first, and we can have some lunch on the way.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I observe that there is a good deal of German music on the programme, which is rather more to my taste than Italian or French. It is introspective, and I want to introspect.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Come along!”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: We travelled by the Underground as far as Aldersgate; and a short walk took us to Saxe-Coburg Square, the scene of the singular story which we had listened to in the morning.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: It was a poky, little, shabby-genteel place, where four lines of dingy two-storied brick houses looked out into a small railed-in enclosure, where a lawn of weedy grass and a few clumps of faded laurel bushes made a hard fight against a smoke-laden and uncongenial atmosphere.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: Three gilt balls and a brown board with “JABEZ WILSON” in white letters, upon a corner house, announced the place where our red-headed client carried on his business.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes stopped in front of it with his head on one side and looked it all over, with his eyes shining brightly between puckered lids.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: Then he walked slowly up the street, and then down again to the corner, still looking keenly at the houses.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: Finally he returned to the pawnbroker’s, and, having thumped vigorously upon the pavement with his stick two or three times, he went up to the door and knocked.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: It was instantly opened by a bright-looking, clean-shaven young fellow, who asked him to step in.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Thank you,” said Holmes, “I only wished to ask you how you would go from here to the Strand.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Third right, fourth left,” answered the assistant promptly, closing the door.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Smart fellow, that,” observed Holmes as we walked away. “He is, in my judgment, the fourth smartest man in London, and for daring I am not sure that he has not a claim to be third.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: I have known something of him before.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Evidently,” said I, “Mr. Wilson’s assistant counts for a good deal in this mystery of the Red-headed League. I am sure that you inquired your way merely in order that you might see him.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Not him.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “What then?”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “The knees of his trousers.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “And what did you see?”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “What I expected to see.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “Why did you beat the pavement?”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: “My dear doctor, this is a time for observation, not for talk. We are spies in an enemy’s country.
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: We know something of Saxe-Coburg Square. Let us now explore the parts which lie behind it.”
scene_description: outdoors, shabby square, dingy brick houses, railed enclosure, weedy lawn

segment_text: The road in which we found ourselves as we turned round the corner from the retired Saxe-Coburg Square presented as great a contrast to it as the front of a picture does to the back.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: It was one of the main arteries which conveyed the traffic of the City to the north and west.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: The roadway was blocked with the immense stream of commerce flowing in a double tide inward and outward, while the footpaths were black with the hurrying swarm of pedestrians.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: It was difficult to realise as we looked at the line of fine shops and stately business premises that they really abutted on the other side upon the faded and stagnant square which we had just quitted.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: “Let me see,” said Holmes, standing at the corner and glancing along the line, “I should like just to remember the order of the houses here.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: It is a hobby of mine to have an exact knowledge of London. There is Mortimer’s, the tobacconist, the little newspaper shop, the Coburg branch of the City and Suburban Bank, the Vegetarian Restaurant, and McFarlane’s carriage-building depot.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: That carries us right on to the other block. And now, Doctor, we’ve done our work, so it’s time we had some play.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: A sandwich and a cup of coffee, and then off to violin-land, where all is sweetness and delicacy and harmony, and there are no red-headed clients to vex us with their conundrums.”
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: My friend was an enthusiastic musician, being himself not only a very capable performer but a composer of no ordinary merit.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: All the afternoon he sat in the stalls wrapped in the most perfect happiness, gently waving his long, thin fingers in time to the music, while his gently smiling face and his languid, dreamy eyes were as unlike those of Holmes the sleuth-hound, Holmes the relentless, keen-witted, ready-handed criminal agent, as it was possible to conceive.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: In his singular character the dual nature alternately asserted itself, and his extreme exactness and astuteness represented, as I have often thought, the reaction against the poetic and contemplative mood which occasionally predominated in him.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: The swing of his nature took him from extreme languor to devouring energy; and, as I knew well, he was never so truly formidable as when, for days on end, he had been lounging in his armchair amid his improvisations and his black-letter editions.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: Then it was that the lust of the chase would suddenly come upon him, and that his brilliant reasoning power would rise to the level of intuition, until those who were unacquainted with his methods would look askance at him as on a man whose knowledge was not that of other mortals.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: When I saw him that afternoon so enwrapped in the music at St. James’s Hall I felt that an evil time might be coming upon those whom he had set himself to hunt down.
scene_description: indoors, ornate concert hall, rows of seats, plush stalls, grand stage

segment_text: “You want to go home, no doubt, Doctor,” he remarked as we emerged.
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “Yes, it would be as well.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “And I have some business to do which will take some hours. This business at Coburg Square is serious.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “Why serious?”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “A considerable crime is in contemplation. I have every reason to believe that we shall be in time to stop it.
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: But to-day being Saturday rather complicates matters. I shall want your help to-night.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “At what time?”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “Ten will be early enough.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “I shall be at Baker Street at ten.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: “Very well. And, I say, Doctor, there may be some little danger, so kindly put your army revolver in your pocket.”
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: He waved his hand, turned on his heel, and disappeared in an instant among the crowd.
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: I trust that I am not more dense than my neighbours, but I was always oppressed with a sense of my own stupidity in my dealings with Sherlock Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: Here I had heard what he had heard, I had seen what he had seen, and yet from his words it was evident that he saw clearly not only what had happened but what was about to happen, while to me the whole business was still confused and grotesque.
scene_description: outdoors, grand theatre facade, evening streetlights, cobblestone pavement

segment_text: As I drove home to my house in Kensington I thought over it all, from the extraordinary story of the red-headed copier of the _Encyclopædia_ down to the visit to Saxe-Coburg Square, and the ominous words with which he had parted from me.
scene_description: indoors, padded carriage seats, small window view, flickering carriage lamp

segment_text: What was this nocturnal expedition, and why should I go armed? Where were we going, and what were we to do?
scene_description: indoors, padded carriage seats, small window view, flickering carriage lamp

segment_text: I had the hint from Holmes that this smooth-faced pawnbroker’s assistant was a formidable man—a man who might play a deep game.
scene_description: indoors, padded carriage seats, small window view, flickering carriage lamp

segment_text: I tried to puzzle it out, but gave it up in despair and set the matter aside until night should bring an explanation.
scene_description: indoors, padded carriage seats, small window view, flickering carriage lamp

segment_text: It was a quarter-past nine when I started from home and made my way across the Park, and so through Oxford Street to Baker Street.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: Two hansoms were standing at the door, and as I entered the passage I heard the sound of voices from above.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: On entering his room, I found Holmes in animated conversation with two men, one of whom I recognised as Peter Jones, the official police agent, while the other was a long, thin, sad-faced man, with a very shiny hat and oppressively respectable frock-coat.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Ha! Our party is complete,” said Holmes, buttoning up his pea-jacket and taking his heavy hunting crop from the rack.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Watson, I think you know Mr. Jones, of Scotland Yard? Let me introduce you to Mr. Merryweather, who is to be our companion in to-night’s adventure.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “We’re hunting in couples again, Doctor, you see,” said Jones in his consequential way. “Our friend here is a wonderful man for starting a chase. All he wants is an old dog to help him to do the running down.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I hope a wild goose may not prove to be the end of our chase,” observed Mr. Merryweather gloomily.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You may place considerable confidence in Mr. Holmes, sir,” said the police agent loftily. “He has his own little methods, which are, if he won’t mind my saying so, just a little too theoretical and fantastic, but he has the makings of a detective in him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is not too much to say that once or twice, as in that business of the Sholto murder and the Agra treasure, he has been more nearly correct than the official force.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, if you say so, Mr. Jones, it is all right,” said the stranger with deference. “Still, I confess that I miss my rubber. It is the first Saturday night for seven-and-twenty years that I have not had my rubber.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I think you will find,” said Sherlock Holmes, “that you will play for a higher stake to-night than you have ever done yet, and that the play will be more exciting.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: For you, Mr. Merryweather, the stake will be some £ 30,000; and for you, Jones, it will be the man upon whom you wish to lay your hands.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “John Clay, the murderer, thief, smasher, and forger. He’s a young man, Mr. Merryweather, but he is at the head of his profession, and I would rather have my bracelets on him than on any criminal in London.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He’s a remarkable man, is young John Clay. His grandfather was a royal duke, and he himself has been to Eton and Oxford.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: His brain is as cunning as his fingers, and though we meet signs of him at every turn, we never know where to find the man himself. He’ll crack a crib in Scotland one week, and be raising money to build an orphanage in Cornwall the next.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I’ve been on his track for years and have never set eyes on him yet.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I hope that I may have the pleasure of introducing you to-night. I’ve had one or two little turns also with Mr. John Clay, and I agree with you that he is at the head of his profession.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is past ten, however, and quite time that we started. If you two will take the first hansom, Watson and I will follow in the second.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes was not very communicative during the long drive and lay back in the cab humming the tunes which he had heard in the afternoon.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: We rattled through an endless labyrinth of gas-lit streets until we emerged into Farrington Street.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: “We are close there now,” my friend remarked. “This fellow Merryweather is a bank director, and personally interested in the matter. I thought it as well to have Jones with us also.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: He is not a bad fellow, though an absolute imbecile in his profession. He has one positive virtue. He is as brave as a bulldog and as tenacious as a lobster if he gets his claws upon anyone.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: Here we are, and they are waiting for us.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime, gas-lit cobblestone streets, tall victorian buildings, deep shadows

segment_text: We had reached the same crowded thoroughfare in which we had found ourselves in the morning.
scene_description: outdoors, busy city thoroughfare, fine shopfronts, stately business premises, wide roadway

segment_text: Our cabs were dismissed, and, following the guidance of Mr. Merryweather, we passed down a narrow passage and through a side door, which he opened for us.
scene_description: indoors, narrow stone passage, heavy iron gates, winding stone staircase, dim lantern glow

segment_text: Within there was a small corridor, which ended in a very massive iron gate. This also was opened, and led down a flight of winding stone steps, which terminated at another formidable gate.
scene_description: indoors, narrow stone passage, heavy iron gates, winding stone staircase, dim lantern glow

segment_text: Mr. Merryweather stopped to light a lantern, and then conducted us down a dark, earth-smelling passage, and so, after opening a third door, into a huge vault or cellar, which was piled all round with crates and massive boxes.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “You are not very vulnerable from above,” Holmes remarked as he held up the lantern and gazed about him.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Nor from below,” said Mr. Merryweather, striking his stick upon the flags which lined the floor. “Why, dear me, it sounds quite hollow!” he remarked, looking up in surprise.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “I must really ask you to be a little more quiet!” said Holmes severely. “You have already imperilled the whole success of our expedition. Might I beg that you would have the goodness to sit down upon one of those boxes, and not to interfere?”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: The solemn Mr. Merryweather perched himself upon a crate, with a very injured expression upon his face, while Holmes fell upon his knees upon the floor and, with the lantern and a magnifying lens, began to examine minutely the cracks between the stones.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: A few seconds sufficed to satisfy him, for he sprang to his feet again and put his glass in his pocket.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “We have at least an hour before us,” he remarked, “for they can hardly take any steps until the good pawnbroker is safely in bed. Then they will not lose a minute, for the sooner they do their work the longer time they will have for their escape.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: We are at present, Doctor—as no doubt you have divined—in the cellar of the City branch of one of the principal London banks. Mr. Merryweather is the chairman of directors, and he will explain to you that there are reasons why the more daring criminals of London should take a considerable interest in this cellar at present.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “It is our French gold,” whispered the director. “We have had several warnings that an attempt might be made upon it.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Your French gold?”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Yes. We had occasion some months ago to strengthen our resources and borrowed for that purpose 30,000 napoleons from the Bank of France. It has become known that we have never had occasion to unpack the money, and that it is still lying in our cellar.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: The crate upon which I sit contains 2,000 napoleons packed between layers of lead foil. Our reserve of bullion is much larger at present than is usually kept in a single branch office, and the directors have had misgivings upon the subject.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Which were very well justified,” observed Holmes. “And now it is time that we arranged our little plans. I expect that within an hour matters will come to a head.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: In the meantime Mr. Merryweather, we must put the screen over that dark lantern.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “And sit in the dark?”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “I am afraid so. I had brought a pack of cards in my pocket, and I thought that, as we were a _partie carrée_, you might have your rubber after all.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: But I see that the enemy’s preparations have gone so far that we cannot risk the presence of a light. And, first of all, we must choose our positions.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: These are daring men, and though we shall take them at a disadvantage, they may do us some harm unless we are careful. I shall stand behind this crate, and do you conceal yourselves behind those.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: Then, when I flash a light upon them, close in swiftly. If they fire, Watson, have no compunction about shooting them down.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: I placed my revolver, cocked, upon the top of the wooden case behind which I crouched.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: Holmes shot the slide across the front of his lantern and left us in pitch darkness—such an absolute darkness as I have never before experienced.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: The smell of hot metal remained to assure us that the light was still there, ready to flash out at a moment’s notice.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: To me, with my nerves worked up to a pitch of expectancy, there was something depressing and subduing in the sudden gloom, and in the cold dank air of the vault.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “They have but one retreat,” whispered Holmes. “That is back through the house into Saxe-Coburg Square. I hope that you have done what I asked you, Jones?”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “I have an inspector and two officers waiting at the front door.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Then we have stopped all the holes. And now we must be silent and wait.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: What a time it seemed! From comparing notes afterwards it was but an hour and a quarter, yet it appeared to me that the night must have almost gone, and the dawn be breaking above us.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: My limbs were weary and stiff, for I feared to change my position; yet my nerves were worked up to the highest pitch of tension, and my hearing was so acute that I could not only hear the gentle breathing of my companions, but I could distinguish the deeper, heavier in-breath of the bulky Jones from the thin, sighing note of the bank director.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: From my position I could look over the case in the direction of the floor. Suddenly my eyes caught the glint of a light.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: At first it was but a lurid spark upon the stone pavement. Then it lengthened out until it became a yellow line, and then, without any warning or sound, a gash seemed to open and a hand appeared, a white, almost womanly hand, which felt about in the centre of the little area of light.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: For a minute or more the hand, with its writhing fingers, protruded out of the floor. Then it was withdrawn as suddenly as it appeared, and all was dark again save the single lurid spark which marked a chink between the stones.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: Its disappearance, however, was but momentary. With a rending, tearing sound, one of the broad, white stones turned over upon its side and left a square, gaping hole, through which streamed the light of a lantern.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor
