segment_text: Over the edge there peeped a clean-cut, boyish face, which looked keenly about it, and then, with a hand on either side of the aperture, drew itself shoulder-high and waist-high, until one knee rested upon the edge.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: In another instant he stood at the side of the hole and was hauling after him a companion, lithe and small like himself, with a pale face and a shock of very red hair.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “It’s all clear,” he whispered. “Have you the chisel and the bags? Great Scott! Jump, Archie, jump, and I’ll swing for it!”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes had sprung out and seized the intruder by the collar. The other dived down the hole, and I heard the sound of rending cloth as Jones clutched at his skirts.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: The light flashed upon the barrel of a revolver, but Holmes’ hunting crop came down on the man’s wrist, and the pistol clinked upon the stone floor.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “It’s no use, John Clay,” said Holmes blandly. “You have no chance at all.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “So I see,” the other answered with the utmost coolness. “I fancy that my pal is all right, though I see you have got his coat-tails.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “There are three men waiting for him at the door,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Oh, indeed! You seem to have done the thing very completely. I must compliment you.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “And I you,” Holmes answered. “Your red-headed idea was very new and effective.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “You’ll see your pal again presently,” said Jones. “He’s quicker at climbing down holes than I am. Just hold out while I fix the derbies.”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “I beg that you will not touch me with your filthy hands,” remarked our prisoner as the handcuffs clattered upon his wrists. “You may not be aware that I have royal blood in my veins.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: Have the goodness, also, when you address me always to say ‘sir’ and ‘please.’”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “All right,” said Jones with a stare and a snigger. “Well, would you please, sir, march upstairs, where we can get a cab to carry your Highness to the police-station?”
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “That is better,” said John Clay serenely. He made a sweeping bow to the three of us and walked quietly off in the custody of the detective.
scene_description: indoors, large stone vault, stacked wooden crates, massive strongboxes, stone flag floor

segment_text: “Really, Mr. Holmes,” said Mr. Merryweather as we followed them from the cellar, “I do not know how the bank can thank you or repay you.
scene_description: indoors, narrow stone passage, heavy iron gates, winding stone staircase, dim lantern glow

segment_text: There is no doubt that you have detected and defeated in the most complete manner one of the most determined attempts at bank robbery that have ever come within my experience.”
scene_description: indoors, narrow stone passage, heavy iron gates, winding stone staircase, dim lantern glow

segment_text: “I have had one or two little scores of my own to settle with Mr. John Clay,” said Holmes. “I have been at some small expense over this matter, which I shall expect the bank to refund, but beyond that I am amply repaid by having had an experience which is in many ways unique, and by hearing the very remarkable narrative of the Red-headed League.”
scene_description: indoors, narrow stone passage, heavy iron gates, winding stone staircase, dim lantern glow

segment_text: “You see, Watson,” he explained in the early hours of the morning as we sat over a glass of whisky and soda in Baker Street, “it was perfectly obvious from the first that the only possible object of this rather fantastic business of the advertisement of the League, and the copying of the _Encyclopædia_, must be to get this not over-bright pawnbroker out of the way for a number of hours every day.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was a curious way of managing it, but, really, it would be difficult to suggest a better. The method was no doubt suggested to Clay’s ingenious mind by the colour of his accomplice’s hair.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: The £ 4 a week was a lure which must draw him, and what was it to them, who were playing for thousands? They put in the advertisement, one rogue has the temporary office, the other rogue incites the man to apply for it, and together they manage to secure his absence every morning in the week.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: From the time that I heard of the assistant having come for half wages, it was obvious to me that he had some strong motive for securing the situation.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “But how could you guess what the motive was?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Had there been women in the house, I should have suspected a mere vulgar intrigue. That, however, was out of the question. The man’s business was a small one, and there was nothing in his house which could account for such elaborate preparations, and such an expenditure as they were at.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It must, then, be something out of the house. What could it be? I thought of the assistant’s fondness for photography, and his trick of vanishing into the cellar.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: The cellar! There was the end of this tangled clue. Then I made inquiries as to this mysterious assistant and found that I had to deal with one of the coolest and most daring criminals in London.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was doing something in the cellar—something which took many hours a day for months on end. What could it be, once more? I could think of nothing save that he was running a tunnel to some other building.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “So far I had got when we went to visit the scene of action. I surprised you by beating upon the pavement with my stick. I was ascertaining whether the cellar stretched out in front or behind.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was not in front. Then I rang the bell, and, as I hoped, the assistant answered it. We have had some skirmishes, but we had never set eyes upon each other before.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: I hardly looked at his face. His knees were what I wished to see. You must yourself have remarked how worn, wrinkled, and stained they were. They spoke of those hours of burrowing.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: The only remaining point was what they were burrowing for. I walked round the corner, saw the City and Suburban Bank abutted on our friend’s premises, and felt that I had solved my problem.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: When you drove home after the concert I called upon Scotland Yard and upon the chairman of the bank directors, with the result that you have seen.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And how could you tell that they would make their attempt to-night?” I asked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, when they closed their League offices that was a sign that they cared no longer about Mr. Jabez Wilson’s presence—in other words, that they had completed their tunnel. But it was essential that they should use it soon, as it might be discovered, or the bullion might be removed.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: Saturday would suit them better than any other day, as it would give them two days for their escape. For all these reasons I expected them to come to-night.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You reasoned it out beautifully,” I exclaimed in unfeigned admiration. “It is so long a chain, and yet every link rings true.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It saved me from ennui,” he answered, yawning. “Alas! I already feel it closing in upon me. My life is spent in one long effort to escape from the commonplaces of existence.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: These little problems help me to do so.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And you are a benefactor of the race,” said I.
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers

segment_text: He shrugged his shoulders. “Well, perhaps, after all, it is of some little use,” he remarked. “‘_L’homme c’est rien—l’œuvre c’est tout_,’ as Gustave Flaubert wrote to George Sand.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian sitting room, fireplace, armchairs, cluttered papers
